meta.title: Tyler Gentry | Founder & CEO, NEED-AID
meta.description: Discover how Tyler Gentry is modernizing humanitarian aid with blockchain-backed transparency, Wyoming DUNA governance, and inclusive digital payouts.

hero.name: Tyler Gentry
hero.title: Founder & CEO, NEED-AID | Consortium Architect, Wyoming DUNA
hero.tagline: Delivering donor dollars straight to people in need—with on-chain accountability and human dignity.

about.summary: Raised in rural Wyoming, Tyler Gentry blends payments innovation with servant leadership—distributing over $3B in relief before founding NEED-AID to bring trust back to giving.

origin_story.headline: From prepaid cards to blockchain rails.
origin_story.copy: As Director of Government & Nonprofit Services at Blackhawk Network, Tyler stood up emergency programs that delivered billions in aid via prepaid cards. Fraud, breakage, and opaque reporting sparked his mission to build something better.

inflection_point.headline: Creating the Wyoming DUNA.
inflection_point.copy: Partnering with the University of Wyoming’s Center for Blockchain & Digital Innovation, Tyler is launching a decentralized unincorporated nonprofit association (DUNA) that lets donors trace every stablecoin to its recipient.

mission.headline: Democratize giving with transparent, inclusive, real-time aid delivery.

pillars.title: Financial Inclusion
pillars.description: Onboard unbanked and underbanked families with simple digital wallets, off-ramps like MoneyGram, and multilingual support.

pillars.title: Transparent Impact
pillars.description: Leverage stablecoins and blockchain metadata so every donor can audit where funds go—no more black-box reporting.

pillars.title: Community Governance
pillars.description: Empower nonprofits to become voting members who direct aid to the most urgent needs in real time.

project.name: NEED-AID & Wyoming DUNA
project.problem: Government checks, prepaid cards, and legacy wires are slow, expensive, opaque, and prone to fraud—leaving vulnerable families behind.
project.solution: NEED-AID’s consortium uses stablecoins, Stellar’s mass disbursement rails, and compliant digital wallets to move funds instantly from donors to recipients while capturing transparent impact data.
value_proposition: Deliver funds in minutes instead of weeks, even across borders, with stablecoin mass disbursements.
Provide donors, auditors, and regulators with real-time visibility into every transaction.
Reduce fraud and unused balances by replacing prepaid breakage with wallet-based KYC and cash-out options.

experience.headline: How the Wyoming DUNA works.
copy: Donors contribute via fiat or digital assets; funds convert to compliant stablecoins.
Participating nonprofits vote to allocate aid based on live, community-sourced priorities.
Recipients receive an SMS/email to claim aid, onboard into a digital wallet, and spend or cash out locally.

features: Stellar Development Foundation mass disbursement toolkit
Wallet partnerships (e.g., Decaf) with MoneyGram off-ramps
Consent-driven data collection for compliance and storytelling
Multilingual onboarding, training, and support for vulnerable populations
Consortium governance across nonprofits, universities, and donors

traction.relief_legacy: Distributed $3B+ in aid across California, Washington, New York, and beyond through legacy payment networks.
traction.wyoming_pilot: Launching December food-security pilot with University of Wyoming; statewide DUNA proof-of-concept slated for mid-2026.

call_to_action.headline: Ready to fund transparently and inclusively?

highlights: Oversaw equitable distribution of $3B+ in public-sector aid during COVID across multiple states.
Architecting a stablecoin-powered nonprofit consortium that returns crypto to its original financial inclusion promise.
Bridging Wyoming’s digital asset laws with Arizona’s freedom-tech ecosystem to modernize social safety nets.
Collaborates with Stellar, Decaf Wallet, and MoneyGram for global-ready disbursement technology.
Ally to NGOs, food banks, and donors seeking real-time accountability with lower operating overhead.

quotes.speaker: Tyler Gentry
quotes.text: We called it NEED-AID because millions qualify for assistance—but legacy rails leave them behind.

quotes.speaker: Tyler Gentry
quotes.text: Blockchain gives donors and recipients transparency we’ve never had—every dollar can be traced from giver to person in need.

quotes.speaker: Tyler Gentry
quotes.text: Stablecoins fulfill crypto’s original promise: bank the unbanked, deliver dignity, and restore trust in aid.

quotes.speaker: Tyler Gentry
quotes.text: Wyoming’s DUNA lets nonprofits co-govern where funds go—democratizing giving in real time.

timeline.event: Served as VP of Business Attraction at Arizona Commerce Authority, recruiting companies to the state and honing public-sector partnerships.
Directed government & nonprofit services at Blackhawk Network, distributing billions in emergency aid via prepaid programs.
Launched NEED-AID consultancy to modernize aid flows and started forming the Wyoming DUNA.
Partnered with University of Wyoming’s Center for Blockchain & Digital Innovation to co-develop DUNA governance.
Planning statewide DUNA proof-of-concept with hundreds of nonprofits directing real-time aid allocations.
